column4: I just installed an application from a script (not the repos). what would be the best way to uninstall it?
alot of scripts have an --uninstall switch
so.. for example?
well for example 'sudo scriptname.sh --uninstall'
alright, will try it. thanks
it's a bash script, is that ok?
yeah. you have a link to the script? maybe someone can look at it
the bash script installed mozilla sunbird to the /usr/bin directory
well.. unless youre concerned about the libs you could just remove the executables for it
here's the script -- http://pastebin.ubuntu-nl.org/35136/
any ideas? :)
rm -fr /etc/opt/sunbird; rm /usr/share/applications/sunbird.desktop; rm /usr/bin/sunbird   should do it
great, thanks. that won't affect the other apps, right?
nope
thanks a lot! what's rm -fr for
ah alright
the -f just means dont prompt me with a y or n. it means force and the -r means recursive so you use that when you want to delete a directory containing files
alright.. thank you so much!!
np
bear in mind youll need to prefface all that with sudo
yup, i guessed as much. thanks a lot, it seems to have worked
